intro: Cassine scandens, commonly known as the climbing cassine, is a woody vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Cassine scandens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
